name: DC Comics (Dark & Crude, Named Characters)

blackCards.text: Batman's real superpower is ____.
Alfred refuses to clean up ____ ever again.
The Batmobile won't start unless you feed it ____.
Commissioner Gordon turned on the Bat-Signal for ____.
The Joker's newest joke ends with ____.
Harley Quinn's idea of self-care is ____.
Bane said the famous line, but he actually meant ____.
Two-Face settled the argument with ____.
The Riddler asked one question too many about ____.
Poison Ivy's plants are thriving thanks to ____.
Catwoman stole ____ and called it cardio.
Superman smiled politely while dealing with ____.
Lex Luthor's business plan is basically ____ with better fonts.
The Flash can outrun anything except ____.
Wonder Woman ended the meeting by producing ____.
Aquaman's biggest problem is ____.
The Justice League's group chat is 70% ____.
The Teen Titans' tower was nearly destroyed by ____.
Gotham's newest villain is just ____ in a trench coat.
Nightwing's acrobatics were ruined by ____.
The Joker and Batman briefly agreed on ____.
Brainiac collected cities, but today he wanted ____.
Darkseid's 'Anti-Life Equation' was missing ____.
Green Lantern tried to manifest ____ and immediately regretted it.
The Watchtower's emergency protocol is called ____.

whiteCards: a cape soaked in rain and unresolved trauma
Alfred's disappointed sigh, weaponised
a utility belt full of receipts
a gargoyle with gossip
the Bat-Signal spelling 'HELP' and then 'LOL'
a Joker smile that lasts too long
Harley's glittery chaos manifesto
Bane's protein shake of doom
a coin flip that decides taxes
a riddle that ends in violence
Poison Ivy's aggressive composting
Catwoman's morally flexible Pilates
Superman's forced small talk with civilians
Lex Luthor's ego in a tailored suit
The Flash tripping over a single Lego
Wonder Woman's 'I am not asking' voice
Aquaman's fish-related diplomatic incident
a Justice League meeting that becomes therapy
a sidekick trying to invoice for emotional damage
Gotham's sewer system containing secrets and worse
a villain lair with terrible Wi-Fi
a dramatic rooftop monologue interrupted by birds
an interrogation lamp that overheats instantly
a batarang thrown with petty intent
the phrase 'I work alone' said in a crowded room
a clown car full of bad decisions
a hostage situation solved by sarcasm
a gadget labelled 'DO NOT PRESS' being pressed
a cape stuck in a revolving door
a crime scene with too many clues and not enough sense
a rooftop chase ruined by wet shoes
a kryptonite paperweight on a desk
a villain speech interrupted by a sneeze
an explosion timed for dramatic lighting
a secret identity saved by pure luck
a bat-themed credit card
a grappling hook that grabs feelings instead
a city that never sleeps because it can't
a clown laugh echoing through the vents
a handbook titled 'How To Be A Menace'
